alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:58AM CDT until June 04 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall that occurred over the Marmaton River Basin on Wednesday will cause the river to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 800 AM CDT.
